p: Studies were carried out to observe the anti-cholinesterase activity of the ethanol n- BuOH extracts of seed of M. pachycarpa Benth. which showed potent activity where n- BuOH extract also showed significant anti-cholinesterase activity. The bio-assay guided isolates of EtOAc extract was evaluated by Ellman’s methods and also showed better anticholinesterase activity which showed moderate to weak acetylcholinesterase activity with an IC 50 value ranging from 17.14 to 131.17 μM, which is the future prospect to analyze as a definite agent for Alzheimer’s therapy ( Tu et al., 2019).
